answers.answer: Refractory balanitis can be frustrating to treat.  The nystatin cream that was prescribed is appropriate.  You can also consider obtaining cultures from the region.  If it grows out any bacteria, this should be treated with appropriate antibiotics.If the symptoms continue, I would consider a referral to a dermatologist or urologist for more definitive evaluation and therapy.Other tests to consider would be blood tests looking for diabetes (which can increase the incidence) as well as syphillis (which balanitis can be mistaken for).These options can be discussed with your personal physician.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.kevinmd_
